Premiere of Dear Matafele Peinam

I’m active as both a composer and theorist. My work often connects with mathematics, including self-similarity and infinite canons, quotient spaces and voice leading, calculus and tempo, and aperiodic rhythms and tilings associated with continued fractions.

I’m a Professor of Composition in the College of Music at Florida State University, Co Editor-in-Chief of the Journal of Mathematics and Music and Associate Editor of Perspectives of New Music.

Say hi by email or on Twitter. Listen to my work on SoundCloud, view projects on GitHub, or read a bio or CV.

This site is built with Jekyll, hosted on GitHub Pages, based on a theme by orderedlist, and incorporates modifications by Mike Grieling.
